_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Facility: Sierra Chemical Co., Stockton Facility, relies on the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management Standard, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) 40 CFR Part 68 Chemical Accident Prevention Program, Risk Management Plan, and the OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120 Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response Standard to guide in the establishment of policies in the efforts and commitment to prevent accidental releases of highly hazardous materials through prevention and emergency response.

Facility and Regulated Substances Handled: Sierra Chemical Co., Stockton Facility, consists of two operations involving highly hazardous materials.  Chlorine is received at the facility via 90 ton railcars. It is repackaged into 17 ton tank trucks, 1 ton containers, and 150 pound cylinders. Additionally, the facility manufactures sodium hypochlorite (bleach) using chlorine as a reactant.  The second operation is a sulfur dioxide container handling and storage process.  Sulfur dioxide containers, 1 ton containers and 150 pound cylinders are received at the facility and stored pending delivery to consumers. 

The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps: Sierra Chemica Co., Stockton Facility, has developed the following programs in the efforts of accidental release prevention: Process Safety Management Guidelines (Sierra Chemical Co. Document HS180.10) and the Accident Prevention Program (Sierra Chemical Co. Document HS105).

The Five-Year Accident History: Sierra Chemical Co., Stockton Facility, has had no reportable accidents per EPA 40 CFR Part 68 in the past five years.  The facility did experience a process upset due to operator error resulting in the release of chlorine gas on 27NOV99.  There were no injuries or off site impacts as a result of the incident. As a result of the incident additional process con

trol was installed at the facility.  

The Emergency Response Program: Sierra Chemical Co., Stockton Facility, has a written emergency response plan (Sierra Chemical Co. Document HS150.20) prepared generally following 29 CFR 1910.120(q).  Applicable plant personnel receive annual training including drills.  Additionally, a copy of the emergency response plan has been furnished to the Local Emergency Planning Committee.  

Planned Changes to Improve Safety: Sierra Chemical Co., Stockton Facility, plans to improve safety by conducting process hazard analysis revalidations as required and through the employee safety committee.
